Package zoo

Class Zoo

java.lang.Object
zoo.Zoo
public class Zoo extends Object
Represents a zoo that manages animals and their habitats.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Zoo

      public Zoo(int cols, String[] habitatTypes)
      Constructor to initialize the zoo with a habitat and animals with an empty ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      cols - The number of columns in the habitat. Should be 1 or more
      habitatTypes - a 1D array specifying the habitat type for each row. Cannot be null or empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if habitatTypes is null or empty, or if cols is less than 1.

  • Method Details

    • addAnimal

      public String addAnimal(Animal animal, Integer row, Integer col)
      Adds an animal to the zoo and places it in the habitat. If row or column is null, it will place the animal in the first available compatible spot. If both row and column are provided, it tries to place the animal at the specified position.

      Note: For success return animal.getName() + " has been added to the zoo." For failure return "Failed to place " + animal.getName() + " in the habitat."; or "Failed to place " + animal.getName() + " at row " + row + ", col " + col + "."; depending on mode of use Only add animal to list if animal is successfully placed in habitat.
      Parameters:
      animal - The animal to add.
      row - The row index in the habitat (may be null).
      col - The column index in the habitat (may be null).
      Returns:
      a string indicating success or failure.

    • showAllAnimals

      public String showAllAnimals()
      Displays all animals in the zoo. See driver for details of the message
      Returns:
      a string representing all the animals in the zoo.

    • showHabitat

      public String showHabitat()
      Displays the zoo's habitat grid. See driver for details of the message
      Returns:
      a string representation of the zoo's habitat grid.

    • sortAnimals

      public void sortAnimals()
      Sorts all animals in the zoo by name and age.

    • findAnimalsByType

      public String findAnimalsByType(Class<?> type)
      Finds and displays all animals of a specific type.

      Message should be "\nFinding Animals of Type: " + type.getSimpleName()); followed by each matching animal per line
      Parameters:
      type - The class type of the animals to find.
      Returns:
      a string representing all animals of the specified type.

    • findVenomousSnakes

      public Snake[] findVenomousSnakes()
      Loops through all animals and returns a 1D array of all venomous snakes.
      Returns:
      an array of venomous snakes.
